remarks: Lemma K of [Crawley] p. 118.  Final result, lines 11 and 12 on p. 120: given two translations f and k with the same trace, there exists a trace-preserving endomorphism tau whose value at f is k.  We use ` F ` , ` N ` , and ` u ` to represent f, k, and tau.  (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-2013.)
statement:
cdlemk7.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdlemk7.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
cdlemk7.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.
cdlemk7.e $e |- E = ( ( TEndo ` K ) ` W ) $.
cdlemk $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( F e. T /\ N e. T ) /\ ( R ` F ) = ( R ` N ) ) -> E. u e. E ( u ` F ) = N ) $.
$d E u $.
$d F u $.
$d K u $.
$d N u $.
$d R u $.
$d T u $.
$d W u $.
